class.name: DiscordChannelHandle
class.brief_description: All messages sent on Discord are done so in a Channel. [method DiscordMessageHandle.channel_id] will contain the ID of the channel a message was sent in, and [method DiscordClient.get_channel_handle] will return an instance of this class.
class.description: Handle objects in the SDK hold a reference both to the underlying data, and to the SDK instance. Changes to the underlying data will generally be available on existing handles objects without having to re-create them. If the SDK instance is destroyed, but you still have a reference to a handle object, note that it will return the default value for all method calls (ie an empty string for methods that return a string).

method.name: id
method.description: Returns the ID of the channel.

method.name: name
method.description: Returns the name of the channel. Generally only channels in servers have names, although Discord may generate a display name for some channels as well.

method.name: recipients
method.description: For DMs and GroupDMs, returns the user IDs of the members of the channel. For all other channels returns an empty list.

method.name: type
method.description: Returns the type of the channel.
